section.title: Files
section.paragraph: Copy the file etc/cinder/api-httpd.conf to the appropriate location for your Apache server, most likely:

Update this file to match your system configuration (for example, some distributions put httpd logs in the apache2 directory and some in the httpd directory). Create the directory /var/www/cgi-bin/cinder/. You can either hard or soft link the file cinder/wsgi/wsgi.py to be osapi_volume under the /var/www/cgi-bin/cinder/ directory. For a distribution appropriate place, it should probably be copied to:

Cinderâ€™s primary configuration file (etc/cinder.conf) and the PasteDeploy configuration file (etc/cinder-paste.ini) must be readable to httpd in one of the default locations described in Configuring Cinder.

section.title: Access Control
section.paragraph: If you are running with Linux kernel security module enabled (for example SELinux or AppArmor), make sure that the configuration file has the appropriate context to access the linked file.
